header.title: Drunk PC who called takeaway staff ‘P***s’ wants her job back
header.postText: A police officer who hurled horrendous racist abuse at takeaway staff in a drunken attack has asked to have her job back.', 'Former copper Katie Barratt has launched an appeal to re-join the police after she was sacked for using racial slurs against Asian employees while on a Northumbria Police staff night out.', 'Barratt was said to be drunk and waiting for her food to be prepared at the Spice of Punjab takeaway in Newcastle upon Tyne in December 2017.', 'The officer, in her 20s, was sacked from the force after a meeting heard that she said: ‘I wish these f*****g P***s would hurry up with my pizza’, while also calling them ‘n*****s’.', 'Barratt – whose comments were not heard by staff – was instantly dismissed for gross misconduct, despite over 20 character references to save her job.', 'Now the former officer – whose life-long dream was to join the police force – has appealed the misconduct panel’s decision.', 'The grounds of her appeal are not yet known.', 'Despite the abusive outburst, Barratt previously claimed ‘there’s no deep, meaningful racism in me’.', 'At a misconduct hearing in June, her solicitor Guy Ladenburg called it an ‘isolated event’ which was ‘quite out of character’.', 'On the night in question, Barratt was described by two colleagues as being so drunk she couldn’t walk properly, when they headed into the empty takeaway at 10.30pm.', 'Barratt claimed she wasn’t a racist and that what subsequently unfolded was ‘not a true reflection of who I am at all.’', 'She added: ‘I’m really sorry for what I’ve done. I can’t emphasise how sorry I am.', '‘It’s my dream job. It’s all I wanted to do since I was little.', '‘I know the effects racial abuse have on the community. I’m absolutely devastated that I have had that effect on the community.', '‘In the last six months I have had time to reflect on my actions and I will never ever repeat again what happened that night.’', 'She continued: ‘I have matured a lot. I don’t go out anymore, I don’t drink. I‘m pleading with you to please give me another chance.’', 'Her appeal is set to be heard at the Office of the Police and Crime Commissioner in Benton Lane.
